docs.snippet: THE PEACE CONFERENCE. In the Peace Conference to-day. JAMES C. SMITH, of New-York, made a strong speech against compromise. Several members say it was one of the best speeches yet made. He took nearly the same ground as that assumed by Mr. FIELD.

headline.main: HIGHLY IMPORTANT FROM WASHINGTON.; The Peace Conference and its Deliberations. Passage of the Tariff Bill Through the Senate. Exciting Debate on the Navy Bill in the House. The Seven Steam Sloops of War Apppropriation Agreed to.Federal Affairs Before the Virginia Convention.ARKANSAS GONE FOR THE UNION!Reported Outrages of the Secessionists in Texas.Abortive Attempt to Hoist a SecessionFlag in Nebraska. THE DEMOCRATS CHANGE FRONT. THE NAVY BILL. MR. DOUGALAS AND THE TARIFF. THE DUTY ON COFFEE. SECESSION AND THE EUROPEAN POWERS. PREPARATIONS FOR THE INAUGURATION. MR. ASHMUN AND THE CABINET. MR. LINCOLN'S HOUSE. THE REPORT ON THE KANSAS CLAIMS. NAVAL MATTIERS. CAPT. MAFFIT AND THE CRUSADER. CAPT. MEIGS RECALLED. THE CONVENTIONS WITH COSTA RICA

docs.lead_paragraph: THE PEACE CONFERENCE. In the Peace Conference to-day. JAMES C. SMITH, of New-York, made a strong speech against compromise. Several members say it was one of the best speeches yet made. He took nearly the same ground as that assumed by Mr. FIELD.

docs.snippet: Such a wonderful stir in the market as the advent of Prof. WOOD'S RESTORATIVE CORDIAL AND BLOOD RENOVATOR. In it we have all the Scientific Medical Skill acquired in a close study of thirty years or more.

docs.snippet: The United States mail steamer Quaker City, Capt. R. W. SHUFELDT, arrived from Havana, haying left there Friday, 15th inst., at noon.

headline.main: NEWS FROM HAVANA.; ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY FEARS OF A DROUTH IN CUBA, &C.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamer Quaker City, Capt. R. W. SHUFELDT, arrived from Havana, haying left there Friday, 15th inst., at noon.

docs.snippet: The Pony Express reached San Francisco on the 3lst ult., with the Eastern news telegraphed to Fort Kearney, of the 24th, containing detailed accounts of affairs at Charleston, S. C., affer the Star of the West was fired into, the debate thereon in...

headline.main: Additional News of the Overland Express.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Pony Express reached San Francisco on the 3lst ult., with the Eastern news telegraphed to Fort Kearney, of the 24th, containing detailed accounts of affairs at Charleston, S. C., affer the Star of the West was fired into, the debate thereon in the United States Senate, and the proceedings in the New-York and other State Legislatures. Altogether it was considered the most alarming intelligence yet received here.

docs.snippet: We know not how to record the monstrous fact, that a suspicion of corruption has been breathed against one of our State legislators; know not in what terms to break to the people of our City and State the sad tidings, that ...
